intro: Maesa kanjilalii, commonly known as the Kanjilal's maesa, is a flowering plant native to the western Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, providing a dense canopy that supports local biodiversity. Maesa kanjilalii is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil.
